questions.question: Which specific files does Hidden File Cleaner remove?
questions.answer: Hidden File Cleaner removes .DS_Store, .fseventsd, .Spotlight-V100, .Trashes, .apdisk, and ._Filename (aka AppleDouble) files.

questions.question: What are these files? Are there any risks with removing them?
questions.answer: They each do slightly different things. For example, the ._ files can be used by macOS to store things like custom icons you can assign in Finder. .DS_Store can be used to remember icon positions in a Finder window. .Spotlight-V100 is used for Spotlight indexing, etc. None of the information in these files is essential, and they are created automatically when you open a drive in Finder.

questions.question: So what's the problem with these files then?
questions.answer: If you only use macOS then typically nothing (they are hidden from you anyway). However, if you transfer files to another computer with a different OS then they will show up, causing confusion and even causing problems in some cases (for example: if you transfer files to a SD card for a game console or other device it may show "corrupted data" when it reads these metadata files).

questions.question: Can't I just use Terminal commands to disable these files?
questions.answer: You can get macOS to stop creating .DS_Store files specifically on certain types of external disks, but unfortunately other types of hidden files will still be created.
